metadata.title: CVE-2016-1682 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
The ServiceWorkerContainer::registerServiceWorkerImpl function inWebKit/Source/modules/serviceworkers/ServiceWorkerContainer.cpp in Blink,as used in Google Chrome before 51.0.2704.63, allows remote attackers tobypass the Content Security Policy (CSP) protection mechanism via aServiceWorker registration.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-1682` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 51.0.2704.79-0ubuntu0.16.04.1.1242
chromium-browser-l10n - 51.0.2704.79-0ubuntu0.16.04.1.1242
chromium-chromedriver - 51.0.2704.79-0ubuntu0.16.04.1.1242
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 51.0.2704.79-0ubuntu0.16.04.1.1242
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 51.0.2704.79-0ubuntu0.16.04.1.1242
No subscription required

liboxideqt-qmlplugin - 1.15.7-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
liboxideqtcore0 - 1.15.7-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
liboxideqtquick0 - 1.15.7-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
oxideqt-codecs - 1.15.7-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
oxideqt-codecs-extra - 1.15.7-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '51.0.2704.79-0ubuntu0.16.04.1.1242').
oxide-qt package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.15.7-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
